channel.title: Comments on: Monday Go Meditation: Game 41

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I'm glad you enjoyed it! I definitely aim to post reviews that kyu players would have a much easier time comprehending and can follow without feeling totally lost. Hope to see you around the comments in the next game review!
item.content:encoded: I’m glad you enjoyed it! I definitely aim to post reviews that kyu players would have a much easier time comprehending and can follow without feeling totally lost. Hope to see you around the comments in the next game review!

item.title: By: Xezlec
item.dc:creator: Xezlec
item.description: Oh wow! That was a magnificent game! Watching really high-level games I have trouble following them, but this is just high enough to be really cool without being so lofty as to be beyond my comprehension. Besides which -- so much drama!
item.content:encoded: Oh wow! That was a magnificent game! Watching really high-level games I have trouble following them, but this is just high enough to be really cool without being so lofty as to be beyond my comprehension. Besides which — so much drama!

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: Looking back, I displayed some insane hubris in letting the group on the right get so close to death. (I depended on at least two mistakes from white to live.) But I had two easy opportunities to keep it safe: http://eidogo.com/#3RwGrUkt:0,99 and http://eidogo.com/#3RwGrUkt:0,0,1. I don't know what I was thinking. Anyway, my claim to be 2k will really be put to the test at the NJ Open. If I can get three wins at that rank, I'll be strutting like a peacock.
item.content:encoded: Looking back, I displayed some insane hubris in letting the group on the right get so close to death. (I depended on at least two mistakes from white to live.) But I had two easy opportunities to keep it safe: http://eidogo.com/#3RwGrUkt:0,99 and http://eidogo.com/#3RwGrUkt:0,0,1. I don’t know what I was thinking. Anyway, my claim to be 2k will really be put to the test at the NJ Open. If I can get three wins at that rank, I’ll be strutting like a peacock.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Congrats man! That was a tough game to watch. Was worried for you! But let's both be honest, you're a secret 2k sandbagger. =P
item.content:encoded: Congrats man! That was a tough game to watch. Was worried for you! But let’s both be honest, you’re a secret 2k sandbagger. =P

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: It's a bit embarrassing how many relatively simple reading mistakes still fill my games. I ended up beating that 1k I played Friday night in the game you saw part of, but we both made so many silly blunders.
item.content:encoded: It’s a bit embarrassing how many relatively simple reading mistakes still fill my games. I ended up beating that 1k I played Friday night in the game you saw part of, but we both made so many silly blunders.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Glad you enjoyed it! I think a lot of players have a tough time when playing against the Chinese Opening, so I'm happy to show these games where I show a counter strategy to it. And in regards to the double hane reading mistake, I can definitely attest to making that mistake numerous times and forgetting my opponent doesn't have to sacrifice. Haha. Ah well. At least we know what we're doing wrong! =)
item.content:encoded:
Glad you enjoyed it! I think a lot of players have a tough time when playing against the Chinese Opening, so I’m happy to show these games where I show a counter strategy to it.
And in regards to the double hane reading mistake, I can definitely attest to making that mistake numerous times and forgetting my opponent doesn’t have to sacrifice. Haha. Ah well. At least we know what we’re doing wrong! =)

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: That's a pretty epic game - full of ko fights and exchanges, and a nice example of early development strategies against the Chinese opening. I echo your advice to always open facing black, rather than diagonal from him. Simply asserting that you are happy to accept a cross-fuseki as white seems to me like a positive, confident way to begin a game. It was also reassuring to see your reading mistake at W132 with the double hane on the second line - I've made that same mistake at least five times. It's like the joy of discovering how powerful that double hane to cut off can be runs ahead of my carefulness in checking if my opponent can simply fix in the original direction and leave my reckless stone adrift.
item.content:encoded:
That’s a pretty epic game – full of ko fights and exchanges, and a nice example of early development strategies against the Chinese opening. I echo your advice to always open facing black, rather than diagonal from him. Simply asserting that you are happy to accept a cross-fuseki as white seems to me like a positive, confident way to begin a game.
It was also reassuring to see your reading mistake at W132 with the double hane on the second line – I’ve made that same mistake at least five times. It’s like the joy of discovering how powerful that double hane to cut off can be runs ahead of my carefulness in checking if my opponent can simply fix in the original direction and leave my reckless stone adrift.
